meanings.definition: A section of the Hebrew Bible read in synagogue as part of the weekly Torah reading.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftoroth aloud to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The haftoroth for this week's Torah portion was particularly moving.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when the haftoroth seemed to whisper secrets to them.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the synagogue as she chanted the haftoroth.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haftoroth lingered in the air long after the service ended.

meanings.definition: The plural form of haftarah, referring to the readings themselves.
meanings.sent1: The haftoroth for the upcoming holidays were carefully selected by the rabbi.
meanings.sent2: In synagogue, the haftoroth are often accompanied by insightful commentary.
meanings.sent3: The haftoroth sat patiently on the bookshelf, waiting to be read.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the haunting beauty of the haftoroth filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The melodies of the haftoroth intertwined with the Torah readings, creating a tapestry of sound.
